1. Toxin cards are shuffled, and one is removed and set aside. The toxin that is set aside is the one for which players will try to find the antidote.
2. Remaining toxin cards are shuffled with syringe cards (See Table 01). Two cards (Three in 3-Player games) are dealt to each player.

3. Antidote cards are selected (see Table 01 for counts), shuffled, and evenly dealt to each player. For example, in a 4-Player game, all cards with a 1, 2, 3, or 4 are selected for each formula, shuffled, and evenly dealt.
4. Once cards have been dealt, players may view and reorganize their hands. All players will have the same number of cards in hand, at all times.
Cards will be discarded over the course of the game. Your goal is for your last remaining card to be an antidote to the hidden Toxin.
Table denoting card distribution at start of game
At the start of the game, a random player will be selected to go first. Play will continue clockwise from this starting player. On your turn, you must take one of 3 actions:
Each player must take exactly one action, after which their turn is over.

Every player will choose a card, and simultaneously discard it to their workstation (the area directly in front of them). Toxin cards (Those marked with an “X”) will be face-down, all other cards will be face-up. Cards on a player\'s workstation are visible to all players.
There are two ways to trade cards:
\t A) All players pass a card face-down to the left or right, OR
\t B) Make a one-card trade with a player of your choice.

A) First, select either left or right. All players will select a single card from their hands and simultaneously pass it face-down in the direction you chose. Then, players add the received cards to their hand.

B) Choose a player to trade with. Discuss terms of the trade, and simultaneously complete the trade face-down, adding the received card to your hand. You may only trade one card. The player can refuse a trade. You must honor the agreement. For example, you can both agree to trade a Toxin card, but you must both actually trade Toxin cards. If no player agrees to trade with you, select a different action.
Note: You can only choose this action if you have a Syringe card in your hand.

Reveal a Syringe card from your hand to “steal“ a card from any player\'s hand or workstation. If you choose to steal a card from a player\'s hand, it is selected randomly and given to you, and they are given the Syringe. If you choose to steal a card from a player\'s workstation, you place the stolen card in your hand and place the syringe on their workstation. You may steal face-down or face-up cards from a player\'s workstation. You may steal from your own workstation.
Eventually, all the players will only have one card left. When this occurs, players reveal their last card. Then, the hidden Toxin, selected at the start of the game, will be shown.
A) If you drink the antidote (i.e. the hidden Toxin matches your last card), you live! You gain points equal to the number on your last card. (See Table 02: Scoring Examples - Example 1)
B) If you do not drink the antidote (i.e. the hidden Toxin does NOT match your last card), you die. You lose points equal to the number on your last card (See Table 02: Scoring Examples - Example 2)
C) If your last card is not an antidote card (e.g. if it is a Syringe), you die and receive -1 point.
Table showing various cases of scoring
Even if you die, you can play again! The winner of a game of antidote is the player with the most points after 3 rounds.
